events.name: Polar Explorers - Lecture and Exhibition Tour
events.description:
"Victory awaits him, who has everything in order - luck we call it.  Defeat is definitely due for him, who has neglected to take the necessary precautions - bad luck we call it." - Roald Amundsen

Science Centre Singapore, in partnership with The Royal Norwegian Embassy, is pleased to present a special lecture and exhibition tour, titled “Polar Explorers”, by Mr. Geir Kløver.  Geir is director of the Fram Museum in Oslo, Norway, and has edited 15 books on Norwegian polar expeditions, including the personal diaries of the crew members on Roald Amundsen´s expedition to the South Pole 1910-12 and the diaries of Fridtjof Nansen.

Mr Geir Kløver will be speaking on the precautions that need to be taken for a successful polar expedition, stories about famous polar expeditions undertaken in the past, and  the science, navigation and survival techniques that these Polar Explorers used to overcome the harsh Arctic conditions.

This event is held in conjunction with the launch of a new temporary exhibition: Explore the Arctic – Past, Present and  Future, at the Science Centre.  Curated by Geir and his team at the Fram Museum, the exhibition covers a wide range of Arctic related topics such as people, animal and marine life, resources, climate change, and pollution. It also tells the story about the two well-known Norwegian polar explorers, Fridtjof Nansen and Roald Amundsen, and their contribution to polar research and expeditions to the Arctic. And last, but not least, the exhibition also explains why the Arctic is relevant for Singapore today. 

Please kindly rsvp your interest to Jenny Leong at: jenny_leong@science.edu.sg.

The lecture and tour are free (Science Centre admission charges may apply).

events.name: Grumpy Gits - Git Learning DevFest Asia 2015
events.description:
Advancing git literacy through talks and workshops. Great for beginners, even better for pros. May the forks be with you.

PROGRAMME:

- Intro to Grumpy Gits

- "Life’s better with Git hooks" – Deepank Vora
Git can be tailored to trigger custom scripts at key points in the development lifecycle. In this talk, we'll learn how we can make our life better with Git hooks.

- Git Exercises

- "Git Config boilerplate" – ChernJie Lim

- Git Exercises

- Open Space
Share your git experiences, ask questions, talk about Git

events.name: Nov/2015 - Open Space (Coaching and mentoring)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Darren Open Space Theme: Coaching “We are uncovering better ways of developing software by doing it and helping others do it… “ In agile development, we emphasis on the need for continuous improvement. To continually improve, we need to learn from others and also teach others to do things in better ways. The theme for this month is in hope to spark discussions around topics like how can we provide assistance across multiple levels within an organization, or how individual seeks for assistance but not limited to just these. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology.  Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT). Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room.Sandeep from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm There is no guarantee of trips after 7:45pm.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: React Native (iOS) workshop
events.description: React Native (iOS) workshop We'll be doing the official tutorial (https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/tutorial.html)  Pre-requisites: 1. Macbook2. xcode3. npm4. npm install -g react-native-cli5. Do the setup and make sure you can run the sample app in the iOS simulator If you can't get the sample app to work... SyntaxError: Use of const in strict mode if you are using nvm, make sure to set the default to v4 and above. e.g. nvm alias default 4
